RECORD.TEXT: 921814879 PUOMC 5609860 85257 746160 11/5/1996 12:00:00 AM AORTO-ILIAC AND FEMORAL POPLITEAL OCCLUSIVE DISEASE . DIS Report Status : Unsigned DISCHARGE SUMMARY ZETZFYFEDALEMNONJESC , RYSTA A UNIT NUMBER : 905-49-01 ADMISSION DATE : 11/05/96 DISCHARGE DATE : 11/12/96 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Aorto-iliac and femoral popliteal occlusive disease . History of coronary artery disease , status post CABG , status post mitral valve repair , status post right carotid endarterectomy and redo right carotid endarterectomy , atrial fibrillation . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Left to right femoral femoral bypass graft on 11/6/96 . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : Also K-lan 90 mg PO BID . BRIEF HISTORY : Ms. Zetzfyfedalemnonjesc is an 80 year old female who presents with pain in the right foot . She also has dis________ right leg claudication with just about 10-15 steps . She comes to the hospital for angiography and plus / minus intervention at angio . On original physical exam , she was a pleasant 80 year old female . Carotids were 2+ on the right , absent on the left with no bruits . She has bibasilar crackles , no wheezes . Abdomen was soft . Extremities : on the right side , she had a +1 femoral on the left , a +2 femoral . The patient was brought into the hospital , underwent angiogram on 11/5 . This showed bilateral significant SFA disease . The next day , the situation was thought to be amenable to a femoral-femoral bypass which was done on 11/6 . She tolerated the procedure reasonably well . Postoperatively , she had a pulsatile PVR on the right leg . She was started on heparin at 600 units an hour , given her history of mitral valve replacement . Vancomycin and Gentamycin were given perioperatively as prophylaxis . She was coumadinized and on 11/12/96 she felt well . She had warm feet bilaterally . PVRs had remained pulsatile . LITALUCRE AKAYSNOUN , M.D. DICTATING FOR : RIODE CALL , M.D. STAT !!!
